Title.evidence: As part of a randomized phase II trial

Intervention.evidence: randomized to perioperative systemic therapy (experimental) or CRS–HIPEC alone (control)

Objective.evidence: the present study compared patient-reported outcomes (PROs)

Method_Outcome.evidence: PROs were assessed using EORTC QLQ-C30, QLQ-CR29, and EQ-5D-5L questionnaires at baseline, after neoadjuvant treatment (experimental), and at 3 and 6 months postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 79 analyzed patients, 37 (47%) received perioperative systemic therapy

Result_Outcome.evidence: worsening of fatigue [mean difference (MD) + 14, p = 0.001], loss of appetite (MD + 15, p = 0.003), hair loss (MD + 18, p < 0.001), and loss of taste (MD + 27, p < 0.001)

Harms.evidence: worsening of fatigue [mean difference (MD) + 14, p = 0.001], loss of appetite (MD + 15, p = 0.003), hair loss (MD + 18, p < 0.001), and loss of taste (MD + 27, p < 0.001)
